unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: General Hypotheses
question_text: Suppose you are told you will do a two-sided $t$ -test for slope.  Which are the correct hypotheses when written out in words?

choices.text: H 0 H 0 :  There is an association between the given two variables. H a H a :  There is no association between the given two variables.
H 0 H 0 :  There is no association between the given two variables. H a H a :  There is an association between the given two variables.
H 0 H 0 :  There is no association between the given two variables. H a H a :  There is a positive association between the given two variables.
H 0 H 0 :  There is no association between the given two variables. H a H a :  There is a negative association between the given two variables.
H 0 H 0 :  There is an association between the given two variables. H a H a :  The association between the given two variables is positive.
